intro: Siloxerus tomentosus, commonly known as the woolly siloxerus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its roots are fibrous and can form dense colonies, contributing to soil stabilization. Siloxerus tomentosus is often found in temperate regions of Asia and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
